pullRequest.title: [DOC] Improve the template documentation
pullRequest.bodyText:
Type of change

Documentation

Description
The 3.8 Customizing deployments chapter (https://strimzi.io/docs/operators/0.18.0/full/using.html#assembly-customizing-deployments-str) mostly focuses on the template feature. I to large extent duplicates the content from the API reference but is on many places out of date.
This PR refactors this part of the documentation:

Information about the templates is moved into the API reference
The section is renamed to Customizing Kubernetes resources which is what it is really about. It now contains deep links to the API reference + the section about customizing Image Pull Policy which is not done through the templates but only through env. var in CO and is therefore nto covered in the API reference.

This should improve the documentation but also its maintainability by reducing the amount of duplicates.

+// This assembly is included in the following assemblies:
+//
+// assembly-deployment-configuration.adoc
+
+[id='assembly-customizing-kubernetes-resources-{context}']
+= Customizing Kubernetes resources
+
+Strimzi creates several Kubernetes resources, such as `Deployments`, `StatefulSets`, `Pods`, and `Services`, which are managed by Strimzi operators.
+Only the operator that is responsible for managing a particular Kubernetes resource can change that resource.
+If you try to manually change an operator-managed Kubernetes resource, the operator will revert your changes back.
+
+However, changing an operator-managed Kubernetes resource can be useful if you want to perform certain tasks, such as:
+
+- Adding custom labels or annotations that control how `Pods` are treated by Istio or other services;
+- Managing how `Loadbalancer`-type Services are created by the cluster.
+
+You can make these types of changes using the `template` property in the Strimzi custom resources.
+The `template` property is supported in the following resources.
+For more details about the customizable fields, check the API reference,
+
+`Kafka.spec.kafka`:: See xref:type-KafkaClusterTemplate-reference[] for more details
+`Kafka.spec.zookeeper`:: See xref:type-ZookeeperClusterTemplate-reference[] for more details
+`Kafka.spec.entityOperator`:: See xref:type-EntityOperatorTemplate-reference[] for more details
+`Kafka.spec.kafkaExporter`:: See xref:type-KafkaExporterTemplate-reference[] for more details
+`Kafka.spec.cruiseControl`:: See xref:type-CruiseControlTemplate-reference[] for more details
